location: England Rochdale, Lancashire, UK   '''William Edgar (Bill) Oddie''', OBE (born 7 July 1941 in Rochdale, Lancashire), is a comedy writer and performer, author, composer and musician. A birdwatcher since his childhood in Birmingham, Oddie has now established a reputation for himself as an ornithologist, conservationist and television presenter on wildlife issues. Some of his books are illustrated with his own paintings and drawings.  Oddie's programmes for the BBC include: ''Springwatch'', ''How to Watch Wildlife'', ''Wild In Your Garden'', ''Birding with Bill Oddie'', ''Britain Goes Wild with Bill Oddie,'' ''Bill Oddie Goes Wild'' and ''Autumnwatch''.
